title: How the FUCK am I trolling because I'm not playing this game for YOUR missions?
body: Go make a god damn 5 premade. I'm not going to be called a troll in champ select because I don't want to play a 5 yasuo comp because you have a quest for it. Fuck these stupid missions I can't even play the damn game anymore

replies.body: But you fking should if the other 4 members of your team clearly agree to it. That's what it means to be a team player in a team game.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuponya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37NVBGzp,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-25T03:27:46.614+0000)
>
> But you fking should if the other 4 members of your team clearly agree to it. That's what it means to be a team player in a team game.

He doesn't have to. Why the hell should he waste his time for some 4 random stranger that mean nothing to him?


Especially toxic people. They do not deserve my or his time at all.

Team player, huh? Innocent words. No one in Odyssey thinks like that. They only want to complete missions. They don't give a shit as long as the mission is completed.

Who's to assume these strangers are toxic at all? I can see why someone wouldn't want to cooperate with rude players, but usually if a random set of 4 has come to agreement together then they're probably not that toxic. No, no one has to do anything they don't want to. It's a game. But unless people are wanting to do 2 aug and you haven't even beaten Onslaught to begin with, why do you get to deter 4 others for no reason other than you don't want to? It's just unsportsmanlike. Trolling? No. Selfish and rude? Yeah.

The point is it's a *request* to do *their* mission. *You can say no to a request*.

Both sides are selfish. No one side is at fault. The fault lies in the system that poorly incorporated these missions.

Just because the majority wants to do something doesn't make the minority selfish for not doing it. The majority is being selfish as well trying to force their mission on someone else.

I agree with this. I literally played game after game where I would get no benefit if we won because the mission that was agreed on was usually 3 aug but I still tried my best to help complete the mission for them.

Hell I even completed a 2 aug run while I still needed to do the 3 aug mission (the guy or gal was relieved as shit when we ended, which was nice to see).

But again this game mode revolves around the limited time missions and compromising makes the experience better (met little to no toxicity this way).

so wait if your 4 teammates told u to play a champ u suck at or hate playing u r the troll for not bending knee to their every bitchy whim?? people want to play this game for missions then ya get a premade team of 5 and go fuck off together..

> [{quoted}](name=Fargo79,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37NVBGzp,comment-id=00000003,timestamp=2018-09-25T10:05:15.102+0000)
>
>  people want to play this game for missions then ya get a premade team of 5 and go fuck off together..

You realize this is not a suitable solution for the masses. Most people rely on randoms because they don't have a sufficient network of people who can get a 5 man premade. 

I am one of these people.

Not to mention posting on boards or reddit may not yield a whole group and is usually people trickling in over time (i've done this and to this day the outcome of doing this is not as favorable as running with randoms).

Now in simple terms this is a game mode which revolves around missions as it has no other purpose (there is no "winning" without the incentive the missions give), while also being time limited meaning compromise is a must otherwise things fall to shit.

Playing for "fun" is a very subjective reason as it is different per individual, but in my opinion the game mode is fun regardless of the mission(s) chosen at any time.

Compromise is not "bending knee" to people, it is accepting that you can make a minor change to benefit or help others while not actually depreciating yourself, because guess what; asking someone to run 2 / 3 augs (or 5 yasuo) doesnt actually ruin the fun, and if it does ruin the fun for you you have the option to ff and carry on. 

Usually if spoken to properly people tend to not be so abrasive, however people tend to stick to the "I do whatever I want" attitude without being considerate and don't ask to leave or ff and that leads to pissing people off.

I literally had a game where the group (being a 4 man premade and 1 random) wanted to do the 3 aug mission (i wanted to do the 2 aug mission but thought I would just help the group) and then 1 person said "I'm playing for fun so I'm running full augs" when asked if there was a compromise the one person zealously pulled the "I do what I want" card, this in turn made the other members of the group irritable resulting in one member getting into an argument with said zealot. 

The thing with that situation was that it ended in a ff anyways but the way it was approached resulted in angst.

Specifically in response to what you first said "if your 4 teammates told u to play a champ u suck at or hate playing u r the troll": You're analogy is heavily skewed in the wrong direction as it is not a choice of as much importance as it is in this game mode where this choice is about the benefit (being all or nothing due to missions) of everyone. In any normal / ranked game your champion is of far less benefit as specifics are not necessary for the team to succeed. Whereas Odyssey Onslaught needs specific comps for wins / missions and thus the choice becomes of greater importance.

The final points I'll make is that both sides have a choice to compromise or just pull away from this, so blaming either side is moot as both sides can be equally toxic.

Honestly I really think Riot should have 2 ques for this type of mode; one which allows progress for missions and one that does not, as to avoid the fun goers clashing with those trying their ass off.

I apologize for the wall of text tho, just wanted to point out reasoning.

Agreed. If it's one or two people trying to do a mission, it's not the worst thing in the world to not go along with it. But if majority agrees and you choose not to, you're just being uncooperative, especially if it's everyone but you.

No one has to play something they don't want to just because majority rules. If 4 wants to play same champ and 1 doesn't, just force a surrender and move on. The 4 can invite each other and start a premade. That's the ghetto style of group finding.

In reply to both you and:
> [{quoted}](name=Z3Sleeper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37NVBGzp,comment-id=000000000002,timestamp=2018-09-25T08:31:55.812+0000)
>
> Some people want to play for fun. I didn't queue up with the intention of trying a new fun build just to do some other person's quest.
> 
> Just be respectful to everyone's intentions and don't pretend it's rude to not want to do something you don't think is fun in a goddamn videogame (especially in a for fun game mode), even if it's a 4:1 ratio.

I'm not claiming the people absolutely have to play what they don't want just for others, I think you both sort of missed the point of what I was saying. It's not trolling or anything to not want to go along with something, and you're never required to play anything. But if 4 people are able to come to an agreement and there's no reason _you_  don't want to go along with it for anything other than "I don't wanna," it's just inconsiderate to those players. Some people play on limited schedules and those 5 minutes of trying to agree in champ select to loading in just to surrender can mess up their ability to play at all, especially since based on my own experience it can happen anywhere from once to 5 times in a row - and coincidentally these are the type of players that usually don't have the option of building a 5 man. 
Not to mention, with a lot of these players I've encountered, if it was something where people tried to agree on stuff in lobby but couldn't really decide and end up with a bad comp or little to no augs, or in a 3v2 situation, they've opted out of surrendering because they want to have fun, despite people not having the augments to have fun as well or not wanting to be in the match to begin with because they have no chance of earning missions. Does everyone do that? No, but it's happened way too often.
Claiming that either side is inherently toxic, however, would be shortsighted as I've seen seeping toxicity from both sides. I've had people yell in champ select "OMG POS GO EAT A COCK GET A 5 MAN"(almost word for word btw) simply because I asked to do the 2 augment mission. I also once had a person sit AFK in Onslaught because people did not go the challenge they wanted, funnily enough we won without them, but still. People choosing to be uncooperative so they can feel like the king of their own world are annoying, people who sit through matches simply to flame you because you didn't pick what they wanted are also annoying.

> Some people play on limited schedules and those 5 minutes of trying to agree in champ select to loading in just to surrender can mess up their ability to play at all, especially since based on my own experience it can happen anywhere from once to 5 times in a row - and coincidentally these are the type of players that usually don't have the option of building a 5 man.

So only I have all the time in the world to favor people. This can go both ways. Maybe I only have a limited time to play too?

Simply put, Riot didn't implement a group finder. So, random queuing and hoping to get people on the same mission is the only way. If that fails, surrender and keep trying. There is no reason to keep wasting 20 - 30 minutes in groups doing 4 aug mission when you're on 2. Doesn't make sense. Even if 4 people are on same mission and I'm not, I'm AFK reading something online or doing something productive like cleaning my room. If they make it to Kayn, I'll come back and help and get it over with it.

Everyone's time is just as precious, not only the majority that agreed in champ select.

Some people want to play for fun. I didn't queue up with the intention of trying a new fun build just to do some other person's quest.

Just be respectful to everyone's intentions and don't pretend it's rude to not want to do something you don't think is fun in a goddamn videogame (especially in a for fun game mode), even if it's a 4:1 ratio.

Except I won’t level up any abilities and I’ll buy 4 infinity edges.

PVE for fun game mode. Play for fun. If 4 other people wanna do their quest instead of playing it out, they can ff and re-queue.

Being toxic in champ select and before the surrender accomplishes nothing but a free report.

Honestly, if you're locking in your pick despite what people are asking of you, you're actually the worst kind of troll. It's a team game, and communication is important. Especially if you're new to the game mode, you should be willing to help out someone else that may well be able to carry you to victory in it. In all likelihood, they chose a lower difficulty setting than they could have, meaning that you'll get an easy win with them having so many augments. All you're doing is wasting other players' time by being stubborn.
ALL OP WANTED WAS A PEPSI! BUT THEY WOULDN'T GIVE IT TO HIM!
I just link the League discord and say "give me something in return or find someone who gives a fuck"
Yeah someone offered me a skin for helping them (they saw my icon) and I was like AIGHT IM IN!

Just dodge; don't waste everyone else's time. I guarantee you the dodge timer is less than being trapped in a game with people who don't want you to be there.

All that said, this is a TERRIBLE way to have the missions; relying on the cooperation of 4 other people one what is widely regarded as one of the most toxic communities is game was a shit idea and I have no idea why Rito went through with it....
Then FF.
